greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(1) = 1; for n > 1, smallest number > 1 which is the n-th power of the sum of its digits, or 0 if no such number exists.
reference: Amarnath Murthy, The largest and the smallest m-th power whose digits sum /product is its m-th root. To appear in Smarandache Notions Journal.
Amarnath Murthy, e-book, " Ideas on Smarandache Notions " MS.LIT
formula: For n > 1, a(n) = A046017(n)^n. - _David Wasserman_, Mar 25 2005
example: a(3) = 512 = 8^3 and no smaller number (>1) can have this property. (This has been established in the reference.)
results.author: _Amarnath Murthy_, Oct 07 2002
